entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued July 13 at 9:58AM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Possible Flash Flooding Friday night through Sunday... An active surface trough is anticipated to develop northeast of the territory by the end of the week. Flash flooding from this feature is possible as the trough lingers in the area Friday night through Sunday. Model solutions have been consistent in enhanced instability and moisture associated with the trough.

entry.summary: ...Hot temperatures, Gusty winds and low humidities Sunday and Monday... .Period of hot temperatures, very dry conditions, and gusty winds associated with a dry cold front late this weekend will elevate fire conditions to critical Sunday and Monday. This will increase fire spread for new and exisiting fires.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 3:47PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Scattered Thunderstorms Through Late Afternoon, Some Strong... Scattered thunderstorms will rumble southeast across the area through 6 pm. A few will be strong producing hail as big as 1/2 to 3/4 of an inch along with wind gusts upwards of 40 mph. Locally heavy downpours can also be expected. Seek shelter indoors should a storm near your location.

entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Nicholas County through 630 PM EDT...
